I am duly authorised by the defendant to sign this statement.

The defendant understands that proceedings for contempt of court may be brought against anyone who makes, or causes to be made, a false statement in a document verified by a statement of truth without an honest belief in its truth.

In order to verify the response to claim by a statement of truth please click “submit” on the next screen. Doing so will be taken as verifying the response by the above statement of truth. Alternatively, you will have the opportunity, on the next screen, to change any of the answers before clicking the “submit” button.

## Legal representatives: specified civil money claims service ### Before you start ### Please note: You can only use this service if you are a solicitor organisation Download and complete the claim timeline template with all events in your timeline. You will upload the template in this service. Please do not upload password protected documents as this will prevent the claim from being processed. claim timeline template. You can complete and upload as many templates as necessary to record all events in your timeline. You can also manually enter your timeline in this service without using the template. If you're claiming interest you will need your interest calculation and dates.

## Email for defendant’s legal representative Use the email address of the legal representative's firm if you have it, otherwise use their personal email.

You can still issue the claim without their email address but the claim will then continue offline.

## Email for second defendant's legal representative Use the email address of the legal representative's firm if you have it, otherwise use their personal email.

You can still issue the claim without their email address but the claim will then continue offline.

HintText:
We accept documents in these formats: pdf, txt, doc, dot, docx, rtf, xlt, xlsx, jpg, jpeg or png. 

Please do not upload password protected documents as this will prevent the claim from being processed.

Label: ## How do you want to add your claim timeline?

## Claim timeline
If you do not know the exact date, tell us the month and year.
### Example timeline
* 12 January 2020 - John Smith gave me a quote to replace the roof.
* 14 January 2021 - We agreed and signed a contract for the work.
* 21 March 2021 - I noticed a leak on the landing and told Mr Smith about this.

How interest to date is calculated

For most types of debt the rate is usually 8%.

To calculate this, we use the steps below.

  1. Work out the yearly interest: take the amount you’re claiming and multiply it by 0.08 (which is 8%).

  2. Work out the daily interest: divide your yearly interest from step 1 by 365 (the number of days in a year).

  3. Work out the total amount of interest: multiply the daily interest from step 2 by the number of days the debt has been overdue.

EXAMPLE
  1. The rate of annual interest is 8%.
  2. Annual interest on, for example, £1,000 is £80 (1000 x 0.08)
  3. Daily interest on £1,000 is 22p (80 / 365)
  4. Total amount of interest on £1,000 for 2 days is 44p (80 x 2 / 365)

There may be additional fees as your case progresses. There may be additional fees as your case progresses.

## List your evidence
Tell us about any evidence you wish to provide. You do not need to send us any evidence now. If your case goes to a court hearing, and is not settled, you will need to provide evidence.

## Claim Amount
 Your claim can be for single or multiple amounts. Do not include interest or the claim fee, you can add these on the next page.
## Do you want to claim interest?
You can claim interest on the money your client is owed. The court will decide if they’re entitled to it.

Help with interest rates
You can claim 8% interest on money owed to you. This is the statutory rate. If you know that a different rate applies you can use that. For example, if you have a contract with a specific rate. The court will decide if you're entitled to some, or all, of the interest claimed.
## How do you want to claim interest?

## What annual rate of interest do you want to claim?
 You can claim 8% per year unless you know that a different rate applies

Help with interest rates
You can claim 8% interest on money owed to you. This is the statutory rate. If you know that a different rate applies you can use that. For example, if you have a contract with a specific rate. The court will decide if you're entitled to some, or all, of the interest claimed.

## What is the total interest for your claim?
 Calculate interest for different periods of time, or items, and let us know the total. We’ll add it to your claim amount.
Show how you calculated the amount

Pay with another PBA
## One PBA listed To pay with a different PBA, email: MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk Ask for your PBA to be registered with your MyHMCTS account and include your organisation name and PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for your account to be updated. You’ll need to start your claim again to pay the fee. ## Two PBAs listed You won’t be able to add another PBA. You can only submit this case online using one of the PBAs from the menu. To remove a PBA, email: MyHMCTSsupport@justice.gov.uk. Include the PBA number. It can then take up to 3 days for the PBA to be removed. We’ll send you confirmation.
